snippet: In the letter, John J. Flanagan, the Senate majority leader, urged the governor to do something about the “regulatory burden imposed” by the city’s universal pre-K program....
abstract: New York State Senate Majority Leader John J Flanagan, in June letter not previously reported to media, urged Gov Andrew M Cuomo to direct State University of New York Charter Schools Institute to take advantage of legislative proposal that would allow charter schools in New York City to run without oversight from New York City; some critics see letter as effort to encourage SUNY to make end run around New York City's regulatory control over prekindergarten offerings.
lead_paragraph: In the letter, John J. Flanagan, the Senate majority leader, urged the governor to do something about the “regulatory burden imposed” by the city’s universal pre-K program.

headline.main: Letter to Cuomo Reveals State Senate’s Plan to Help Success Academy
headline.print_headline: Letter to Cuomo Reveals Senate’s Plan to Help Charter Network
